intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium murorum subsp. hololoma, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering stems bear numerous small, yellow disk flowers. The species is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural and natural areas.
